title: The Reign of Terror: Re-Thinking the 9/11 Conspiracy
description: "When a group of people get together, plot in secret, and execute a crime, that fits the most basic definition of conspiracy."In The Reign of Terror, Kieran Wanduragala plunges into the 'who, why, and how' of conspiracies and the frightening possibility that it is a part of normal political behavior.This book will intrigue and provoke hardened conspiracy-believers and conspiracy-skeptics alike; but for the undecided and open-minded, it is a treasure-trove. Ranging across continents and centuries, from ancient Rome through 9/11 to present-day Syria and Lebanon, from Greek philosophy to neoconservative ideology, from Cold War skullduggery to the dark side of the American psyche, the author paints an intriguing, entertaining, and surprising picture of conspiracy as an ongoing mode of politics.About the Kieran Banda Wanduragala, of Irish and Sri Lankan heritage, was born in the UK and grew up in the USA, of which he is a citizen. He read Philosophy, Politics, and Economics at Balliol College, Oxford and holds an AM in Middle Eastern Studies from Harvard. He speaks Arabic.
author: Kieran Wanduragala
